Essential oils are concentrated plant extracts that retain the natural smell and flavor, or essence of their source. Essential oils can be inhaled or applied to the skin, and may stimulate our sense of smell or have medicinal effects when absorbed. There are over 90 commonly used essential oils, each associated with certain health benefits. High quality oils only use pure plant compounds extracted by distillation or cold pressing. One should avoid using oils that have been diluted with synthetic fragrances, chemicals or oils.
